bio: Back. Bigger. Better. Which button is the Record button again?
You know those guys that do things sometimes? Yeah, that's us.
#FeartheMullet

Stepdad Productions is a group of teenage runaways, hoping to make it in this cruel world in whatever way they can. They're hoping to win the 72 fest to have enough money to buy a train ticket to boston.
Animation. Plagued.
Adam Grayson and Casey Morin have come here to chew bubblegum and make movies...and we're all out of bubblegum...
A team dedicated to creating great films!
We make short films in the DC metro area. 2,500 lbs is less of a "limit" and more of a "goal."
We're a group of slick lizards who smoke cigars and play backgammon. Ain't nobody messin' with us.   (Previously known as Directors from the Black Lagoon)
Two guys, a girl, and a camera. Thatâ€™s the dream
After a year of hibernation in a bunker deep within the earth, we've emerged to embark on a mission of vengeance.
Not to be confused with team Visually Weird.
We like to make neat stuff.
Second time's the charm

Our team is comprised of mostly military veterans, all of whom are members of Veterans in Film & Television Los Angeles. Our Civilian team members, like our Vets, are working professionals in this little industry of ours. We've been a part of the 24 and 48 hour film projects and are thrilled to be a part of the 72 Hour Film Fest.
We're a group of Presidential Innovation Fellows looking to innovate the bejesus out of films (or at least learn how to use a camera).
We're here to chew bubblegum and make movies...and we're all out of bubblegum.
loading ...

Da/Nu Productions led by Daniel Wyland , actor /writer/producer/director decided to put together some of the best acting students from Maryland Ensemble Theater and join the 72FF 2015 competition as a film makers team.
Our team is made up of military veterans, spouses and dependents.
Just a ragtag team of adventurers out on a mission to make a cool film.

Formed in 1992, The Comedy Pigs are the Maryland Ensemble Theatre's resident improv and sketch comedy group, and have been known to make a catchy video or two. Now they are throwing their hats into the ring with the big dogs in order to get a sweet slice of some 72 hour film-fest action!
Diverse group of students from South Jersey who bonded over a class project making a silent film interpretation of the classic radio play, Under Milk Wood.

Our creative team consists of a couple who are far too familiar with maladaptive daydreaming for their own good. Kimber, an experienced amateur screenwriter - discovered her passion five years ago. Five happy years, 30 scripts later. She's been writing ever since. A self proclaimed film junkie, with more film trivia stored in her head than IMDB, she's in route to becoming an architect.    Brayden, being both brains and brawn - brings a level of genius to the mix, all his own. He is vastly experienced with sound and video editing. While in school full time pursuing a degree in mathematics, he has helped create and shoot several short projects.    With the help of some inspired friends and family, we join together in hopes of making our best project yet.
We are a new production with previous experience. We're excited to be participating in the 2015, 72 film fest.
Shut up, Kevin!

Back again to the critics' dismay.  Our filming family in disarray.  Our dreams of reaching the second round,  Long now buried six feet down.  With children grown and too much time.  Our best production is this rhyme.
RE: FW: FW: FW: Moonslaves team bio! This team thought they could make a short film, you won't believe what happened next. LIKE/&COMMENT/&SUBSCRIBE
Empty Bottle Studios is the combined effort of several individuals to make something worthwhile and entertaining.

films.title: The Other Side Of The Coin

bio: A group of Towson graduates and students who make cool movies and stuff.

From the Career and Technology Center in Frederick Maryland, a group of teens from diverse backgrounds have come together to apply our knowledge, creativity, and passion for film production. With experience in video shooting, editing, and screen writing, we use our talents to bring a story to life to inspire others.
The ultimate goal is to have access to the 8th dimension.

Wayne Denier and David Wahl are lifelong friends (and nerds) who have collaborated on creative ventures in the past, including a recent board game, TUNDRA. David has worked on Henlivision entries for 72 Film Fest in previous years, providing artwork, voice acting, and assistant shooting for their trademark stop-motion animated films. Wayne has experience with marker board animation and live stage performance and puppetry, including the recent Maryland Ensemble hit, Materialize. Both men have a great passion for the blend of creative and technical acumen required for animation and film.
Garrison, a seasoned editor and Ellie, a professional nail biter are coming to create a kick-butt film!... If all goes as planed.
We're back with some fresh faces and new ideas.

films.title: Samantha Spade and the Case of the Speeding Brain

bio: returning from a brief hiatus to film something heinous
Our team is a new team based out of the Catoctin area. We are Student film makers wanting to show our stuff.
